meanings.definition: To look through or examine quickly or casually.
meanings.sent1: She overbrowsed the magazine at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overbrowse articles online when I'm bored.
meanings.sent3: He overbrowsed the menu, but ended up ordering the same thing as always.
meanings.sent4: The detective overbrowsed the evidence, searching for any clues.
meanings.sent5: The student overbrowsed the textbook before the exam, hoping to find key information.

meanings.sent1: She tends to overbrowse the bookstore, spending hours there.
meanings.sent2: I always overbrowse the options before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: He overbrowsed the clothing store, trying on every item in sight.
meanings.sent4: The librarian overbrowsed the shelves, organizing books for hours.
meanings.sent5: The traveler overbrowsed the map, planning every detail of the journey.

meanings.definition: To look over or survey from a higher vantage point.
meanings.sent1: She climbed the tree to overbrowse the entire park.
meanings.sent2: I love to overbrowse the cityscape from the top of the hill.
meanings.sent3: He overbrowsed the landscape, taking in the beauty from above.
meanings.sent4: The hawk overbrowsed the field, searching for prey below.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut overbrowsed Earth from space, marveling at its vastness.
